ResourceHeader.ResourceName: CRRES HEEF electron equatorial distributions vs.L

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description:
This data set holds half-orbit (~5 hour) resolution 
electron distributions (19 5-deg equatorial pitch angles vs. 19 energies) 
from the High Energy Electron Fluxmeter (HEEF) on the CRRES spacecraft.  
The energy range covered is 0.3-7.5 MeV.  These data are developed from 
the 1-min insitu pitch angle distributions by assigning each 5-deg bin 
in pitch angle a corresponding McIlwain L value and then by mapping the 
insitu pitch angle distribution to the equator, into 0.05-wide L bins, 
assuming first adiabatic invariant conservation.  The mapping yields 
equivalent equatorial pitch angles.  Flux data are for a given half-orbit, 
given 0.05-wide L bin,  given equatorial pitch angle and given energy bin
are then averaged.  Data records are for a given half-orbit and given
L bin; each record contains averaged fluxes vs. equatorial pitch angle
and energy.  The data are in SGI(UNIX) binary format.  Read software
is contained within the companion documentation.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge Donald Brautigam at AFRL.
